content: we all have that go-to beanie that we reach for time and time again when it gets chilly out this one is mine and i m sure it will become yours too the combination of the thick folded brim and the tightly woven lattice cables creates a dense heavy fabric that will keep you warm no matter the weather i would recommend this pattern to intermediate knitters who have experience working with cables the yarn i used for this pattern is stitch please chunky by premier yarns i ve tried so many wool yarns over the years and they re often scratchy and uncomfortable to wear not this one it s 100% wool yet it feels soft and luxurious to the touch and it comes in so many beautiful colors to choose from the best part is that it s extremely affordable to fit any budget give it a try you ll love it you are more than welcome to sell anything you make using this pattern i just ask that you credit me as the designer and include the link to the pattern on ravelry you may not claim this pattern as your own and you may not sell or distribute its contents in any form if you have any questions you can reach me at thechesapeakeneedle@gmail com copyright september 2022 all rights reserved approx 150-180 yards 118 m of heavy worsted 4 to light bulky 5 yarn i used a little over 1 skein of stitch please chunky in the color rust in the wind us 9 5 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge as well as size 9 dpns for the decreases dpns optional if you use magic loop us 7 4 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles for the brim optional cable needle or double-pointed needle common notions such as locking stitch markers yarn needle and scissors approx 20 in 51 cm around and 8 in 20 5 cm tall with the brim folded up 17 sts x 21 row = 4 in stockinette stitch st s stitch es k knit p purl sl slip purlwise k2tog knit the next 2 stitches together as one stitch skp slip the next stitch knitwise knit the next stitch then pass the slipped stitch over the knit stitch excluding the skp stitch all slipped stitches are slipped purlwise with yarn in back you will have 108 sts in each round until you reach the decrease section i used us size 9 5 5 mm needles for my entire beanie as i like a looser fit but some of my testers chose to use a smaller size needle for the brim to make it tighter if you want to do this i d recommend a us size 7 4 5 mm needles as listed in the materials section cast on 108 sts being careful not to twist sts join to work in round and place marker to show beginning of round for a folded
